snippet.textDisplay:
I think the problem with VAR is that they often take too long to make a decision and also they see it in slow motion. You have to see it in game speed. If you have to slow down your frames to see IF there;s something there then it's not football. Review it in normal speed and make a decision fast just like a referee would.
I'm in favor of VAR but don't make it that detailed and annoying
snippet.textOriginal:
I think the problem with VAR is that they often take too long to make a decision and also they see it in slow motion. You have to see it in game speed. If you have to slow down your frames to see IF there;s something there then it's not football. Review it in normal speed and make a decision fast just like a referee would.
I'm in favor of VAR but don't make it that detailed and annoying

snippet.textDisplay: What happened to Guardiola's so-called mind games before the Liverpool game? I wouldn't go as far as calling him "Fraudiola", but he made himself look stupid by trying to comment on Mane's alleged diving when he had enough problems of his own. Klopp immediately had a response regarding City's tactical fouls and he had no response to that (which Rodri even admitted to struggling to learn). He tried a The Actress tactic and failed rather than being himself. Anyway, it looks like he has a serious rebuilding job on his hands (with so many protagonists above 30 years old and the problems in defence), which is new territory for him.
snippet.textOriginal: What happened to Guardiola's so-called mind games before the Liverpool game? I wouldn't go as far as calling him "Fraudiola", but he made himself look stupid by trying to comment on Mane's alleged diving when he had enough problems of his own. Klopp immediately had a response regarding City's tactical fouls and he had no response to that (which Rodri even admitted to struggling to learn). He tried a The Actress tactic and failed rather than being himself. Anyway, it looks like he has a serious rebuilding job on his hands (with so many protagonists above 30 years old and the problems in defence), which is new territory for him.

snippet.textDisplay: Otamendi is the blues version of Phil Jones in the reds of Manchester, or is shaping up to be. Plz dish in ur opinions for ppl who watch football regularly bcuz I don't but based on the few news reports n journalists I read n see that seems to be the case. Anyone?
snippet.textOriginal: Otamendi is the blues version of Phil Jones in the reds of Manchester, or is shaping up to be. Plz dish in ur opinions for ppl who watch football regularly bcuz I don't but based on the few news reports n journalists I read n see that seems to be the case. Anyone?

snippet.textDisplay:
Otamendi is not a good defender for Pep’s system. I still don’t know why he keeps him around. He simply cannot defend in space, and he dives in too much.

Kyle Walker was the second best player on the pitch, behind Bernardo Silva. He was constantly trying to cover for Otamendi’s shortcomings.

Mendy also needs to leave, I think after 3 seasons it’s clear that it hasn’t worked out for him at City. Either play Angeliño or Zinchenko. It’s probably due to the injuries but he’s been unable to play 5 decent games in a stretch.

That said, Another center back is needed at City ASAP. I don’t know what’s the asking price for Koulibaly these days but they need a commanding center half. Otamendi just cannot be trusted. At this rate City will struggle to quality for the champions league.
snippet.textOriginal:
Otamendi is not a good defender for Pep’s system. I still don’t know why he keeps him around. He simply cannot defend in space, and he dives in too much.

Kyle Walker was the second best player on the pitch, behind Bernardo Silva. He was constantly trying to cover for Otamendi’s shortcomings. 

Mendy also needs to leave, I think after 3 seasons it’s clear that it hasn’t worked out for him at City. Either play Angeliño or Zinchenko. It’s probably due to the injuries but he’s been unable to play 5 decent games in a stretch. 

That said, Another center back is needed at City ASAP. I don’t know what’s the asking price for Koulibaly these days but they need a commanding center half. Otamendi just cannot be trusted. At this rate City will struggle to quality for the champions league.

snippet.textDisplay: Suggest to use VAR on limited basis in a game. Same like tennis player, a referee in football should be allowed to use VAR max 3 times only, once in each half and once discretionary at his request and not when pressured by the players. This will also help the game run smoothly without much intervention.  Otherwise, VAR is going to kill the beautiful game.
snippet.textOriginal: Suggest to use VAR on limited basis in a game. snippet.textDisplay: Pep is a one dimensional manager. He believes in one system of play and he will not change it, regardless of whom he's facing.  City, when attacking play with their midfielders up high as well as the fullbacks, leaving a lot of space between the defense and the attack, space that can be exploited by a quick counter attack when City loses possession.  Most teams have figured this out.  I believe Wolves, who are a great counter attacking team, would have won even if there was no sending off.  It actually became more difficult for Wolves when City went down to 10 men, because City became more compact.
snippet.textOriginal: Pep is a one dimensional manager. He believes in one system of play and he will not change it, regardless of whom he's facing.  City, when attacking play with their midfielders up high as well as the fullbacks, leaving a lot of space between the defense and the attack, space that can be exploited by a quick counter attack when City loses possession.  Most teams have figured this out.  I believe Wolves, who are a great counter attacking team, would have won even if there was no sending off.  It actually became more difficult for Wolves when City went down to 10 men, because City became more compact.

snippet.textDisplay: I don’t think Guardiola has ever had a good defensive setup for any of his teams. The only difference is that with Barça he had Pique, Puyol and Alves to make up for that. Pep’s systems are always possession based with fast movements with the assumption that as long as the team holds on to the ball they won’t get attacked. His Bayern team was always exposed on the counter and so is Man City. They are beautiful to watch but vulnerable at the back. Pep seems to be loyal to his style of play, or maybe he’s just stubborn. Anyway he won’t we a champions league unless he focuses on good defending
snippet.textOriginal: I don’t think Guardiola has ever had a good defensive setup for any of his teams. The only difference is that with Barça he had Pique, Puyol and Alves to make up for that. Pep’s systems are always possession based with fast movements with the assumption that as long as the team holds on to the ball they won’t get attacked. His Bayern team was always exposed on the counter and so is Man City. They are beautiful to watch but vulnerable at the back. Pep seems to be loyal to his style of play, or maybe he’s just stubborn. snippet.textDisplay: To be fair, VAR isn't as bad in Germany or France as in England, partly because there are actually competent independent referees in these countries. snippet.textDisplay:
It was quite a game! Here’s my opinion and I’d love some feedback:
1. At the kick off I thought it was going to be quite a tough and exciting game with city only leaving with at least a point.
2. I personally am quite reserved with red cards so I thought ederson could have escaped with yellow card
3. Thought it was interesting to see man city being able to put one in despite man down
4. With a man down I had no doubt wolves were gonna push higher and wider and get those crucial goals in. Was surprised it came so late in the game.
5. Credits to wolves for the win even though they had a tough first half. Credits for city for holding on as long as they could! In the words of the wise Evra: “I LOOOOOVE THIS GAME!!! Ha ha ha!!!”
snippet.textOriginal:
It was quite a game! Here’s my opinion and I’d love some feedback: 
1. At the kick off I thought it was going to be quite a tough and exciting game with city only leaving with at least a point. 
2. I personally am quite reserved with red cards so I thought ederson could have escaped with yellow card
3. Thought it was interesting to see man city being able to put one in despite man down
4. With a man down I had no doubt wolves were gonna push higher and wider and get those crucial goals in. Was surprised it came so late in the game. 
5. Credits to wolves for the win even though they had a tough first half. Credits for city for holding on as long as they could! In the words of the wise Evra: “I LOOOOOVE THIS GAME!!! Ha ha ha!!!”
